thread.title: SAG Awards 2017: The 10 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet
thread.title_full: SAG Awards 2017: The 10 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet

author: Calin Van Paris
title: SAG Awards 2017: The 10 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet
text:
SAG Awards 2017: The 10 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet January 29, 2017 9:21 pm View Slideshow 

The 2017 SAG Awards red carpet was a study in sleek, lustrous beauty looks that shone quietly, allowing whimsical dresses to have their scene-stealing moments. Naomie Harris celebrated her Moonlight nomination with slicked, side-parted, pin-straight hair and glowing skin that kept the focus on her striped jumpsuit. A heavily dusted onyx gaze lent Kerry Washington’s hair length a modern feel, while Emily Blunt’s take on the behind-the-ear-tuck was rendered romantic by way of coppery lids and statement earrings. 
Always the red carpet ingenue, Michelle Williams played off the abbreviated nature of her peroxide pixie with a metallic scarf wound once around her neck, the accessory offering a bridge between rose-tinted lips and light-catching Vuitton dress. Meanwhile, the fiercely feminine ruffles of Salma Hayek’s butter yellow Gucci gown found a pretty match in her mane of soft, side-swept waves. That same playful sense of ease was echoed by The Crown ’s Claire Foy, whose intricate Valentino dress paired seamlessly with a soft updo and face framing strands, proving that, while she may be new to the Hollywood scene, she’s off to a royal red carpet start.
